champ.champInfo:
The organization and conduct of the competition is entrusted to the leadership of the Dnipro Branch and the Ternopil city public organization "Kyokushin-kan Karate Federation", the organizing committee and the panel of judges appointed for these competitions

Organizing committee and judges:

  • Chief judge of the competition: Chungin M.P.. National representative from International Honbu KIKO 5 Dan
  • Assistant head judge: A.P. Sibilov. President of the Ternopil Federation Kyokushin kan 3 Dan
  • The supreme observer of the competition is the representative (Branch Chief) of the Kyokushin-kan Karate-do international organization in Ukraine, Shikhan Shchygolev Andriy Olegovich (5 dan)
  • National representatives and observers from International Honbu KIKO:
    • Andrii Olegovich Shchygolev, 5 Dan
    • Gladky Boris Mykolayovych 5 Dan
  • Technical support â€” Tatarchenko I.Yu. (Lviv)

Venue of the competition: Ternopil, SC "Politehnik" (Bilohirska St., 32).

The competition will be held in Ternopil on April 12-13, 2024.

Competition program

April 12 (Friday):

  • 10:00-18:00 room preparation, participant registration, mandate and medical commission, weighing
  • 18:00-20:00 judges meeting

April 13 (Saturday):

  • 08:00-09:00 registration of competition participants, weighing of athletes, mandate and medical commission
  • 09:00-09:30 judges meeting
  • 09:30-10:00 ceremonial opening of the competition
  • 10:00-14:00 preliminary matches
  • 14:00-19:00 final matches
  • 19:00-20:00 end of competition, awarding of prize winners

Competition rules.

  • Competitions are held in the "Kumite" section according to the Olympic system, according to the Kyokushin-kan karate rules approved by the Ministry of Family, Youth and Sports of Ukraine in 2004.
  • Competition judging is conducted in accordance with the standards and rules of the Kyokushin-kan International Karate Organization. The composition of the team: the number of participants in each age and weight category is not limited, a coach-representative and a judge are mandatory.
  • In case of insufficient number of competition participants, presence of different levels and qualifications of athletes in a weight category or other reasons, for the purpose of high-quality and safe conduct of the competition, the organizers of the competition have the right to make the following changes:
    • combine some weight and age categories;
    • introduce new weight and age categories;
    • to hold competitions in the appropriate weight categories according to the round-robin system.
  • If the athlete does not appear on the tatami after the announcement of his name within 1 minute, the athlete is considered defeated
  • Neither the organizers of the competition, nor the panel of judges, nor anyone else are responsible for accidents and bodily injuries that may occur during the matches

  • After the first round, 5 athletes (the number of participants is more than 8 people) or 4 athletes (the number of participants is less than 8 people) who scored higher points and go to the second round
  • Three winners are revealed in the second round (1st, 2nd, 3rd place)
  • The starting score in the 1st round is 6
  • The starting score in the 2nd round is 7

Financing

The expenses for the organization and holding of competitions are provided by the Ternopil City Federation, the public organization "Federation of Kyokushin-kan Karate", as well as at the expense of other extra-budgetary revenues

Awards

  • Athletes who took 1-3 places are awarded with cups, medals, diplomas of the respective degrees
  • Valuable and honorable prizes from the Ternopil city Kyokushin-kan karate-do federation based on the results of the competition are awarded to athletes for the best technique and the will to win

Registration

Registration for participation in the competition takes place through a personal account until March 31, 2024. Or to the e-mail of the organizing committee with the subject of the letter "application for participation in the "Championship of Ukraine" competition:
(hidden) or (hidden) or (hidden)

Specialized software is used during competitions. Therefore, applications must meet the following conditions:

  • Applications are submitted only in MS Excel format. The application template can be downloaded directly from the tournament page
  • In applications, you must fill in only what is written. Do not write any additional information in the columns
  • The program itself calculates the participant's age, so you must enter the date of birth correctly
  • Distribution into one or another category occurs in such a way that the participant's weight should not exceed the upper range. That is, if you specified a weight of 25.3, then this is a -30 category, not -25

All questions regarding the submission of applications by phone.+380677887728 (Ihor Tatarchenko)

Final originals of applications for participation in competitions together with documents confirming these applications (passports, birth certificates), or personal applications of participants, necessarily certified by a physical education dispensary, together with an insurance policy, budo passport (certificate or qualification book of an athlete) , are submitted by the official representative of the team to the mandate committee by 09.00, April 13, 2024.

Reference information regarding the accommodation and meals of the teams - by tel. +380965527355 (Lyubov Dmitrivna)
